intro: Agrostophyllum callosum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit with silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. Agrostophyllum callosum is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall.
